The chicken sandwich was delicious! There's definitely a twist on the flavor maybe even a little bit fishy, this is not your average chicken sandwich but it's so good. I also got spicy instead of mild and it's kinda spicy, it left my lips burning.
The staff was nice and it looks like they've added outdoor seating.
I can't wait to come back and try out the rest of the menu.

name: Regina Xu
text: So glad this place finally opened! They have so many more options compared to your usual Korean friend chicken place. The fried chicken is prob the best I’ve tried in the area: perfect crispness and not greasy at all. They also have cool flavors like honey butter and honey cheddar and both were so good. The OVEN CHICKEN IS ACTUALLY SO DELICIOUS - so tender and juicy, think your fav rotisserie chicken but 10x more flavorful and juicy, the flavors they have also go crazy. Cant wait to come back and try all the flavors!!!

name: Jose Valles
text: Thought I'd do my "support your local business" routine today and decided to try this newly opened place.  First checked out the food/menu pictures displayed on the window and it looked like something I'd like.  So ordered their lunch special (L4 includes  2 crispy leg/wing (mild), with option of rice and coleslaw $9.99) and it did not disappoint.  Tasted as expected... actually very good, just like it looked in the menu pictures.  Chicken had the right crispiness and taste, not greasy at all, even the coleslaw was just right.  Everything was perfect, even the amount of food (which I didn't quite finish)  was filling enough for a $10 meal.   So if you have a hankering for tasty crispy chicken - without having to settle for a KFC meal - check this place out.  Like I said, it did not disappoint... better than expected actually.
address: Vons Chicken, 12740 La Mirada Blvd, La Mirada, CA 90638

name: Lin Schmidt
text:
Renting ski equipment from Black Tie was so quick and easy. Emily set me up for a 3 day rental. She was very friendly and knowledgeable. After 2 days,  one of my boots was really bothering me. I went back in and Ryan found me a different pair. He made several adjustments to the boots until they were comfortable. These boots made all the difference! So glad I exchanged them! Ryan went above and beyond! It really made my last day of skiing so much more enjoyable.
They will also meet you right at the mountain if you need to switch out equipment! Black Tie really makes it easy!

resp.text: Thanks so much for your business and the great review. We are always more than happy to swap out equipment for our clients if anything is not working out well. Ski boots can certainly be a tough one. Great to hear that the crew went above and beyond to provide you with a great rental experience. We keep all equipment history on file, so we will certainly reference that info on any future rentals and can set you up with your preferred ski boots out of the gate. Hope to hear from you in the future and thanks again.

name: Wayne Schoeneberg
text: Unforgettable, remarkable, customer for life. I just got back with a family of five from 4 days of skiing in mammoth mountain. Being the sole person that had to arrange everything using BTS made the process smooth, easy, accommodating and fantastic. I haven't been skiing in 20 years and this was my first time back with small kids and seniors some who have never skied before. The whole staff was incredible and unbelievably over the top, friendly, helpful and nice. It's rare to find service like this these days. I am a VERY hard customer to please. Nothing EVER goes right for me and being in business for my self I am extremely critical of any little thing that goes wrong, from a crooked uniform, personal appearance, a slip of the tongue, a roll of the eyes, or a hint of a bad attitude none of that was present when dealing with this organization. They bent over backwards in being available, handling special requests, dealing with my problems, last minute changes and making me feel like I was their best and only customer on the entire mountain. Like a few of the others I rarely write reviews, however these people more than exceeded expectations and totally blew me away. I want to go out of my way to tell you this place is - PHE-NOM-A-NAL!!!

resp.text: Thanks so much for your business and the wonderful review. Our goal is always to create a customer for life, so we are thrilled to hear that we achieved that goal. We are very proud of our amazing staff and it is great to hear they were able to provide such a positive experience for your family. We look forward to hearing from you in the future.

name: Zach H
text: I would compare my experience with this store to buying paint from Walmart.  You will have to help yourself until you bother an employee for assistance, only to realize that the employee probably has little to no experience with paint.  I was able to look past the poor customers service because some of our friends had mentioned a few colors from Dunn-Edwards.  We were finishing up a project and I stopped by to grab some swatches, but they had already locked the doors.  It was 12:55 PM according to my iPhone, a very accurate time.  The employee standing there, probably the one who had locked the door, would not turn his head.  I would have been in the store 3 minutes prior, but I had to drive around to find parking because they've marked off about 10 empty spots in the front of their store for "employees only".  As I walked to my car, I noticed employees walking out of the back and hopping in their cars, parked in the unmarked spots.  Next time, I'll just go to Lowes.  They carry better paint anyways (Sherwin Williams).
address: Dunn-Edwards Paints, 1850 Douglas Blvd #200, Roseville, CA 95661

Amazing paint!  We had never used Dunn-Edwards paint and we are absolutely impressed with the results!  Single coat, no need to touch up!  We are thrilled with the results!

name: Chelsea Pearse
text: On June 11th, after my chair massage was over they attempted to charge my debit card and claimed it to be “down” due to poor internet connections. However, on my end- I was charged $40. $30 + a $10 tip I do EVERY SINGLE TIME I’ve gone for the past 3 years. Over the years they have changed owners and I. Between the 11th and today, the 21st they have again switched their name. I was kind enough when I left on June 11th to leave them my credit card info to be fair that they were paid accordingly. Upon being told my card was declined today, she proceeds to pull out a piece of paper with my name and CC # and said I was going to be charged that amount as well. I refused to pay for a service 2 times and showed her proof of the initial payment that they indeed did take that money from my account. PLUS today’s chair massage. She calls the boss, puts him on speaker and he SCREAMS at me- who knows what the hell he said. I check my account and they used my cc # I had written down and charged me for the last visit, plus today’s! I am LIVID. I have been a loyal customer, at least 4-5 times a month and always a very generous tipper. They will never see me again. I have now had to cancel my credit card, because they didn’t SHRED IT two weeks ago and attempted to unlawfully charge me again. Well, my bank has blocked them and they’ve lost a customer. During my massage a “gentleman” walked in and asked if anyone was “available to take a shower afterwards”.... hmmmm.... gross. What kind of place are these new owners running over there?! I’d advise anyone to avoid them at all COST.
address: Happy Spa & Massage (Formerly Hawaii Massage & Spa), 910 Pleasant Grove Blvd #150, Roseville, CA 95678

name: David Crowther
text:
I own and manage storage facilities and have thousands of doors. And these are *by far* the worst.  These doors were used often in the 90's and I had heard they went out of business.  We had a repair done this week and I was very sad to see a porvene door show up.  They have an incredibly cheap hasps that gets more complaints than any other door we have used in over 40 years of development.  They are difficult to open or close, easy to cut with a bolt cutter, and over time tend to push the railing up and leave a gap between the ground and the door that increases over time.

I sincerely wish the company would have stayed closed.  Customers do not know how to open the hasp at first, you have to show them.  Also they create more customer service issues and repair/work order than any other door by triple.  Please never use them-- if you also hate these doors I would love to hear your rant... mutual hatred for a terrible product is good for the soul.

Finally, I attached a photo from a repair a few months ago.
address: Porvene Doors, 4119 S Market Ct # D, Sacramento, CA 95834

name: Lucas Mathews
text: I love this church. The vision of Making Much of Jesus is being lived out, not only on the stage but in the small groups and individually. The church is also active in the community through Origin Coffee and The Grace City Center. The one thing you won't find here is self-help. The preaching consistently brings you back to Jesus as your only hope and greatest treasure.
address: Origin Church, 4600 Winding Way, Sacramento, CA 95841

name: Michelle Ramazzina
text:
I'll attempt to be brief, but I could write a novel on why I love Origin Church! Mostly, I appreciate the dedication to: the solid preaching of the Bible, the rich heart of worship, the value placed on children, and the way my family is loved so well.

When we moved to the Roseville area, my husband & I knew we wanted Word-rich messages (as opposed to topical sermons with Bible verses sprinkled in here & there.) I love how the sermons- usually given by Pastor Mark South- dig deep into the text of the Bible, often leaving me wishing my mind could hold more info.

The majority of the corporate worship songs occur after the preaching. I love this approach, as my heart is ready & able to respond to what the Lord has just revealed through the Word, and I am given the opportunity to do so through the singing of worship songs. (Also, there are a TON of gifted musicians here!)

Having young kiddos, I greatly appreciate that Origin Church values children. My kids are hearing Gospel-centered teachings each week and are undoubtedly loved.

Since we're not from the area, it has been important to me that we find a community of people who love Jesus and can love my family through the ups and downs of life. At Origin, I have friends who have laughed with me, cried with me, prayed for me, and lovingly corrected me...where I come from, that's called family.
address: Origin Church, 4600 Winding Way, Sacramento, CA 95841

name: Brandon R
text: Origin has been our church family since late 2013. We have grown under both the consistent and faithful expository and gospel-centered preaching of Mark South, and in community with those in our local mission-focused small group community. In an age that still seems to value programs galore and a bread a circus Sunday morning presentation, my wife and I find Origin's first-century church life approach more than refreshing, but life-giving and vital for growing as a disciple of Christ who makes other disciples. And this isn't at the expense of other helpful ministries within the church, such as a weekly women's Bible study and occasional events for the men. I would highly recommend you come visit us on Sunday morning at 10:00 to see if this is the church to which God might be calling you.
address: Origin Church, 4600 Winding Way, Sacramento, CA 95841

name: Kevin Pense
text: 5 Stars (6 if i could)! Origin has been our home now for almost 2 years and we are here to stay. I feel Christ's love for me through this church in every area of it's ministry. I have been encouraged through the ministry at Origin to make much of Jesus in my life, marriage and work and I see God making me more into the image of His Son in all of these area's. Origin's Gospel centered and Biblically based ministry is being used by God to transform lives in Roseville and the sacramento region to the glory of God.
address: Origin Church, 4600 Winding Way, Sacramento, CA 95841

text: My repentance, my baptism, my heart to serve, all started here, at Origin. :) There's never a day in the week that goes by and I don't say "I can't wait till Sunday."

text: I love kombucha and been waiting for a kombucha brewery to open up. I normally love boochcraft but they were taking to long. Didn’t even know local roots existed until I came for a private event. Thank goodness! The kombucha is good and the best thing it’s alcoholic and still has that good effect of kombucha! The place is big and cool. Pet friendly. Live band. Only thing I didn’t really like is too many kids running around crazy. It’s like they are drunk of the non alcoholic one! This is where all the mommies go and let their kids run wild! I don’t blame them, it’s because it’s delicious and can’t let the kid hold you back from getting your kombucha fix.

text: Beautiful place to come relax and have a drink. They don't have food so don't come hungry, but instead come ready to have great drinks and enjoy some games

resp.text: Thanks for the kind words Robert - Glad you had a great time. Starting this coming Friday we are filling our weekend calendar with food trucks. Check out our calendar on our website for details. Cheers!

name: Andrew Roberts
text:
Where to start? Such a great spot to have drink. The kombucha is not very acidic or super sweet like I was expecting from experiences at other places. They have a menu with a good amount of tasting options and believe me when I say they all taste REALLY good. The Strawberry Mojito was excellent, I definitely recommend starting there if its your first time with kombucha.
Local Roots looks and smells like its brand new, and from my opinion they have made the space into a very nice place to come after work and enjoy some downtime. They have Jenga and Cornhole for entertainment as well as a couple TVs and plenty of seating space.
Definitely a spot I will be visiting again soon and I would recommend this place as a must visit spot.

resp.text: Thanks for the great review Andrew! We hope to see you again soon! We’re always working to get better so let us know if there’s anything we can do to improve.

Office restoration fees near $400 and late payment fee of $79 for not being at fault

address: Fitness Machine Technicians, 2323 Main St Unit D12, Irvine, CA 92614

name: Pam Ikeda
text:
My husband and I decided to put together a home gym and ordered a Sole F80 treadmill from the manufacturer.  The treadmill came in a HUGE box on top of a long pallet - definitely too much for us to move and handle on our own, much less assemble by ourselves!  I googled fitness equipment assembly services and Fitness Machine Technicians came up as a local (SoCal) business.  A quick look at some of their reviews assured me that they seemed to be a solid, reputable company.  I made an inquiry about their service area on their website and received a quick, personal response via text.  We set up a date/time for the installation and their prices were quoted to me up front.  The technicians (Chris and his associate) communicated with me on the install date and since they were running early, asked if I they could come by a half-hour early.  (<--- super great in my book because I have waited many hours for service people to show up during a 4-6 hour timeframe!)
They arrived right on time, and they completed the assembly within an hour.  Their work area was clean.  I'm using my new treadmill regularly and will definitely be contacting Fitness Machine Technicians for its preventative maintenance to keep it running smoothly.  I highly recommend this company for any exercise equipment assembly, installation, or maintenance.

resp.text: Thank you for your patronage, and for sharing your experience - we hope you enjoy your new treadmill!

address: Fitness Machine Technicians, 2323 Main St Unit D12, Irvine, CA 92614

Excellent customer service!!

resp.text: Thanks for sharing your feedback, Susan - we hope you enjoy your new elliptical trainer!

name: Villa Balboa
text: So glad I found Fitness Machine Technicians.  I'm a single woman and always afraid of being upsold or taken advantage of.  I called several tech repair people and narrowed it down to two.  I chose Fitness Machine and I am happy I did.  My Star Trac treadmill was working just fine and then I went to turn it on and it wouldn't turn on...I thought oh boy...turns out Chris looked under the HEAVY treadmill and saw that the under plug had wiggled loose and wasn't making a good connection.  He simply tighten the cord, did a general over all maintenance check and was on his way.  Nothing else was needed and he didn't fabricate maintenance or repairs that were not needed.  Was professional and honest. Steve was very helpful over the phone and didn't loose patience with me.  Would recommend and use again.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words, Villa!  We are committed to providing the best value possible to our customers, and do our best to keep costs to a minimum.  I'm glad that we were able to get your treadmill back up and running for you, and we will look forward to working with you again in the future!

text: If you spend money on a home gym, don't waste it by installing it yourself.  Call the pros at Fitness Machine.  I ordered a 3K home gym and thought I could handle it.  I am relatively handy. He came masked and gloved and worked hard to get the job done right.  Best investment I could have made.  It works perfectly... He even suggested I rotate the machine to give the garage more space.  He was right about that as well!

name: Robert Wascher
text:
I bought an expensive elliptical machine 2 years ago, and the thing squeaked and squealed from the very beginning. I had a repairman come out last year, and he attempted to fix the problem. The metal-on-metal squealing noise improved a little bit, but never completely went away.

Over time, the screeching noise became worse and worse. I was about ready to junk the machine, and buy a new one, when I saw an online ad for Fitness Machine Technicians. So, I decided to give them a try.

Chris came out and completely disassembled the elliptical machine. He was quickly able to find the cause of the noise, and he fixed it on the spot. He also cleaned, lubricated, and calibrated the machine.

A few days later, I got back on the machine and was very pleased that it no longer made any noise at all! Also, the action of the machine was much smoother than it ever was before, even when it was brand new.

I cannot say enough good things about Chris, or Fitness Machine Technicians. I was ready to send this elliptical machine to the junkyard, and now it is like a brand new machine. I am completely satisfied with the quality of the service that was provided, by the professionalism of the technician (Chris), and by the very reasonable cost of this extensive repair job. I will definitely have Chris come back for all future routine preventive maintenance, and any other needed repairs, from now on!

resp.text: I'm so glad that we were able to save your machine, and make your workouts quieter - thank you for taking the time to share your experience, and we'll look forward to working with you again!

text: I was recently in San Diego with two of my teen boys and popped into Taba's.  I have been looking at rugs for over 5years from Beijing to Rome, NYC to Miami, etc. I wasn't expecting to find what I was looking for but ended up buying 2 rugs!  There were many reasons, I think, I haven't bought before.  1) There was not a selection, 2)the prices were insane 3) Noone took the time to educate me about what I was buying.  Taba not only took the time to educate and help me find the right rugs but also taught my kids some valuable life/entrepreneural lessons.  I feel like we have made a friend for life. I was very surprised at his selection, knowledge and reasonable prices.  He really worked with me to stay in my budget. I bet I've been in over 100 rugs stores while searching and I will only buy from Taba.  You will not be disappointed shopping here.  You will enter as a customer but leave as family. name: Leticia Rodriguez
text: Most definitely! Taba Rug Gallery deserves a 5 star rating and If I could add more I would! I finally had decided to re-decorate my home. I went and bought new furniture for my living room, dinning room, my home office and guest room and even thou the new furniture looked great I still needed that something to complete the rooms. A friend of mine had mentioned that she had just bought a rug for her mom's living room and recommended that I go to Taba Rug Gallery store. She said he carried  gorgeous rugs and very reasonable prices and that I would definitely find what I was looking for there. But I still wanted to go shop around and look at other rug stores, but they were either to expensive or they didn't have what I was looking for. I'm so glad I took my friends advise.  The owner's name is Taba my friend told  me that he's been in business for more then 25 years and if you ever want to know about the quality or anything about the rugs that he is very knowledgeable on all the different types.  When I arrived at Taba's gallery I knew right away this was the place I would buy my gorgeous rugs from. Taba makes you feel right at home! from the moment you walk in.  I had taken pictures of my rooms and took them with me so I could pick what I was looking for and still I couldn't make up my mind which rug I should put in which room....so he offer to come to my home and bring several of the rugs to try in each of the rooms and he was right that's the best way you can see what looks good in each room!. I am so happy with my new decorated rooms. I think they look awesome!. Thanks! to Taba for helping me pick the rugs that would complete my rooms. For any one that's looking to decorate any room in their home or office and they need a rug to complete that room.....take my advise go and visit Taba's Rug Gallery store first before going anywhere else...you won't regret it!!! you won't need to go anywhere else.....I love my rugs!!!.
address: Taba Rug Gallery, 7848 Girard Ave, La Jolla, CA 92037

name: Michele Hwu
text: About 2 months ago, I was looking for 2 area rugs for our home and I had the best experience working with Taba, the owner, and the day I walked into his store, I got to meet Steven Tyler from Aerosmith (and previous American Idol judge) who was shopping at the store too and bought a beautiful, contemporary rug from Taba! (More about that later). I was on a budget but wanted to find 100% hand knotted or machine woven wool rugs. I knew these rugs, especially hand knotted ones, could easily run in the many thousands which we could not afford, but I kept looking online and in local stores to see if I could find something my family could afford, because I learned these would be the least toxic rugs (we have 2 young kids). I tried buying one online but learned the hard way that there are many nuances so it's best to see the rugs in person so you know and can feel what you are getting. I wasn't even sure if it would be worth my time to try to find a wool rug in La Jolla (I assumed things would just be too pricey) but when I called the store to ask if they carry 100% hand knotted or machine woven wool rugs (avoid hand tufted rugs and be watchful of 'hand woven' rugs - need to ask more questions to clarify what that means), Taba was sooo friendly and welcoming and said he would help me find something that would meet my budget. When I walked into the store, I saw Steven Tyler walking out! It was hard not to recognize him with his multi colored feather hat : ). Taba greeted me and I asked him, "Is that Steven Tyler from Aerosmith?!" Taba showed me the rug Steven picked out and said Steven would be back in 15 minutes to pick it up. When he finished ringing up his purchase, Taba helped me look through his selection of rugs. He carries a wide variety of styles and sizes and it was easy to find 2 rugs that would look great in our home and ended up being cheaper than I expected (literally got 2 rugs for almost the same price of 1 rug I was looking at another rug store). He took the time to explain the difference in quality and what to look for in a good rug and did not rush or pressure me in any way. It was such a pleasant experience. When Steven Tyler came back in to get his credit card and rug, he looked rushed and irritated (news people and cameras were following him). I couldn't help but ask Steven for a photo but he said he was really in a hurry. I watched in amazement as Taba immediately greeted him again and engaged him immediately in conversation. Steven was so at ease and chit chatting with Tana that not only did I end up taking a photo of Taba with Steven but Taba also took a photo of me with Steven! I was one happy customer! Whether you are a wealthy celebrity or regular walk in customer on a budget, Taba will do his best to take great care of you. I love supporting family owned businesses!
address: Taba Rug Gallery, 7848 Girard Ave, La Jolla, CA 92037

text: I do know what others mean as far as service... they're not very friendly. I haven't been treated rudely like others have stated, but not very warmly either. They do have several workers "follow" you around, at least that's what it feels like. They just happen to be restocking each aisle you go down. They're looking for shoplifters, I get it - but I've gone there tons of times, never carry a purse or bag, always just the little baskets they provide, I'm always dressed business casual and still get followed. They are the only place I can find spikes and so far they haven't disappointed. The review from NL below from 5 months ago is obviously someone affiliated with the shop which makes me wonder why the need to defend others experiences? If anything, that review sounded more like whining about bad reviews instead of taking them as constructive criticism and strive to be friendlier and more helpful! And complaining about the other shops in the area? Tacky! I have been to the shop next door tons of times (the one across the street is more expensive)... they are anything but poor quality!! They also lack in friendly atmosphere but they have a FAR better selection of other items like charms and clasps so I'm not sure how they "copied" Beads & More...

name: Terence
text: It was my first time doing a reiki healing session. It was very calm and uplifting. After the session I remember feeling blissful and thinking clearly and being in a serene state of mind. Definitely advise those who haven't to take some time to do the sound bath and reiki healing session.

name: Brenda England
text: I did the Chakra Balancing healing service with Beauty Divine for the first time in my life. This service includes chromotherapy, crystal grids, sound therapy and aroma therapy. I personally always feel like I have good energy flow but I wanted to experience this therapy to insure all my chakras are open without blockages. I’m a writer and it’s important for me to feel balanced for ultimate creativity. The closest I had come to Chakra balancing was wearing a bracelet! Beauty Divine is a master! She is very knowledgeable, professional and punctual. She explained the entire process during the consultation so I knew what to expect and then set up the most amazing environment for you to truly experience the healing. I was extremely relaxed. She has a very gentle touch and makes you feel very comfortable. Once I was lying on the table breathing the aromas, I could feel vibrations from the crystals immediately! This combined with the chromotherapy and the sound therapy, I literally felt like I was traveling to a different realm. I had to squeeze the balls in my hands to remind me I was still here! I allowed myself to fully let go and let Beaty Divine do the healing. I loved every aspect of this experience. I feel centered, balanced and an overall sense of purpose. My dreams have also been very vivid since then. I’m looking forward to doing Reiki next time!

resp.text: Thank you for this beautiful review. Glad to facilitate space for healing. Looking forward to next time ✨🙏🏾✨

name: Tim Smith
text: Our family has had the pleasure to have Dirk and State Farm in our lives for going on close to 20 years.  Whenever we have questions, concerns or are making future plans, Dirk is always extremely responsive and ALWAYS goes the extra mile.  I know we aren’t the only ones that gets this type of treatment, this is just how he and Eric treat everyone who walks through their doors or calls their lines.  We recently had a claim that required body shop workforce about two weeks.  He not only suggested a fantastic shop, but did a personal pick up  when prior plans fell through to get me back home and made several trips to check in on the repair progress throughout the process and sent us update pictures.  Truly first class, small town hospitality and care.  I wouldn’t want to chance any sort of fly-by-night operation that may offer slightly better rates when I know exactly the type of care our policies receive with Dirk.  Seriously a one of a kind person and business owner.  You won’t be sorry.
address: Dirk Vermeulen - State Farm Insurance Agent, 590 N Yosemite Ave Ste 2, Oakdale, CA 95361

name: Melissa F

name: Caitlin Montcrieffe
text:
TL:DR Stay away if you don't know much about cars or the approximate, fair price of auto repair.

I want to preface this review by saying that my stepfather has been a patron of this auto shop for a long time and has had mostly good experiences.
That said, my experience went differently.

For reference: 2007 Mercedes C230 (well maintained with ~116,000 miles)

I brought my car to the shop because I had a check engine light and a check oil level light on (which I assumed meant that I had waited too long to get an oil change and that I was leaking or burning oil). When I called to check in on the status of the car I was given a breakdown of the malfunctioning systems and the cost of the work.
Rodney quoted me the following:
~$830:
$154 x2 (each diagnostic test)
$330 for cam shaft sensor replacements (2)
$190 for an oil change (full synthetic)

I was pretty shocked at the overall cost of the analysis and repairs considering there was no sign of serious issue.
I called Jiffy Lube immediately, just to compare prices and they quoted me ~$110 for an oil change. That's an $80 increase from a local competitor.

I asked my stepfather to call the shop and ask for a similar breakdown. After finding out that I was related to a longtime patron of theirs, (with many referrals and many serviced cars), Rodney informed me that he had spoken to the manager and they would void all of my costs. Considering my experience with this shop, that didn't sound coincidental.

When my stepfather spoke to Rodney, they gave him the same breakdown of costs but also added in that my front brakes were very low and needed to be replaced. This was surprising considering I had replaced my rear brakes earlier that year. I found this unacceptable that Rodney gave additional information, seemingly important, to my stepfather but neglected to give me, the car owner the same information.
Long story short, I took my car to a different shop and they gave me a similar diagnosis and fix list with much different prices.

I only needed 1 cam shaft sensor replaced (not 2, as the invoice had stated), my rear brakes were at 6mm (not 2mm, as they stated), and the oil change was done for ~$110.
Total paid: $300

Lastly, I asked my mechanic to check over everything - just to be sure. They found that my front brakes (installed by Timmons around March 2020), were not pinned in fully - which can be dangerous. My mechanic corrected Timmons' error in my rear brakes and for free.

Today, Rodney gave me a call to find out if I wanted to move forward with the repairs not knowing that I had already repaired my car. I asked him to reiterate the information about my front brakes again, and he verbally confirmed that they were low. In short, he lied.
address: Timmons Auto & Truck Repair, 2855 Contra Costa Blvd D, Pleasant Hill, CA 94523

name: Peter Gohler
text:
I have been working with Timmons for a little over 2 years now.

They are a family business, employing multiple generations. Not only do they work together but play together as well. Their passion for their work extends to their race team. Which is out charging multiple weekends a month. The knowledge and talent which makes them successful on the track extends back to everything they do in the shop.

I have three Fords. A 2014, 2003, and 1979 Ford F-250 4x4 custom truck. Timmons has ensured the reliability of all three vehicles. Their knowledge runs deep. They have no problem tackling problems associated with vintage vehicles. The owners decades of experience makes working on carbs and tuned exhausts as easy as modern low mileage commuter vehicles.

I have thoroughly enjoyed working with the great staff at Timmons. Their professionalism and personal touch are always appreciated.

I always leave on long cross country camping trips with confidence, knowing these guys have done their best to maintain my vehicles.

Their shop is special in that they easily accommodated large RVs and  specialize in recreational and commercial vehicles.

It is always fun to go down to the shop and see what is in the parking lot.

name: Betsy Fessler
text:
Not wanting to write this at all.  Completely wish things had been handled completely different.  Hate the time this is taking to try to resolve.

We brought our motorhome to Timmons per the request of a potential buyer. They wanted it evaluated by a mechanic.  An appointment was made, and we were requested to have it there by 9 a.m.  Despite the fact that we were coming from the south bay, my husband had it there by 8:30.

I arrived by 10 a.m. to pick him up, and our RV still had not been taken back for its inspection.  So we went for breakfast and some shopping. 4 more hours went by, and my husband was starting to go crazy (the shop said they would try to have it done by noon).  So at 2 p.m., my husband called, and the shop told us the evaluation was finished.  It was finished, but they never called us to pick it up.  Huh.

We came to pick it up, and Dave had to ask my husband how to operate our leveling jacks.  The e-brake was not on, which is required to operate them.  There is a reminder pre-printed on the switch panel.  An RV mechanic should have knowledge of that.

Timmons also raised a concern to the buyer (not us) about the headers.  Our coach has a Banks Power kit.  We assume he was questioning whether or not they were legal.  Not only is it smog legal, it was installed in California by Camping World, and the most recent smog inspection was 3 months ago.  The smog report was in a folder we left in the coach next to the driver's seat.  And if that wasn't convenient, it could have be verified by quickly looking online, calling Banks Power, looking at the manuals that were in the RV, or even asking us before raising unnecessary concern with the customer.

I was watching when our coach was being delivered to the front.  It was time to drive home. I noticed that the turn out of their lot was very tight, and the right rear of our coach was extremely close to the adjoining building.  However, I thought nothing about it, until the next morning.

The next morning, my husband walked outside to notice that the right rear corner of our coach had been dented and scraped.  My husband called the service adviser and left a message.

The service adviser didn't call back.  The owner Dave called back, and my husband explained what he had found.  The owner questioned it, which we found insulting.  We had repaired minor damage in that corner prior, and it was flawless prior to taking it to Timmons.  Dave then seemed to speak as if he already knew that the damage was there.  If that is the case, they weren't going to say anything, and hoped that we wouldn't find it.  Not very honest.

Dave asked for photos of the damage, which we emailed.  We were never called back.  So we called to verify Dave'e email address.  The lady answering (Dave's wife?) was rude, assuming we were solicitors.  She didn't want to give Dave's correct email address.  After finally agreeing to give it, we re-sent the photos, and still didn't hear back.  So two days later, my husband called in the morning and left Dave a voicemail.  Still no call back.

We, until recently, owned a substantial body shop in the south bay.  We dealt with the occasional difficult customer with false accusations of damage. We always had 4 corner pics of the car, and could usually prove the customer wrong.  If we couldn't, we fixed it.  It was the right thing to do.  We always wanted our customers to be happy.  We always wanted to prevent those damaging bad reviews.

I have friends in Concord who are regular customers, and bring their RV's to Timmons.  Upon hearing of our experiences, they are very surprised to hear about the level of customer service that we received while we were at Timmons.  They have asked us to keep them updated on how the issue with the body damage is resolved.  I am sorry to say that so far I have no good news for them.

We are left with an RV that is now worth less than when we brought it to Timmons.  Also, we have not heard back from the potential buyer, partially due to concerns that were raised based on seeming lack of knowledge about RV's.

resp.text: Betsy, since we are finally able to respond to these, we wanted to, even though this is from a long time ago. We always take all of our reviews very seriously and know that we cannot always please everyone, even though we never stop striving to. We thank you for taking the time to leave a review and respect those people who do it with good intentions to try and help or inform for the purpose of improvements being made to better the business, rather than, to be destructive and with bad intentions. We wish you and your family the best and truly hope all is well with you.

name: Megan Luby
text: I’ve only gone to them twice so far- once for an initial dermatology exam and once for microdermabrasion - so this review may be altered at some point. The receptionists told me multiple times that my appointments would be covered by my insurance and that the only thing I had to pay out of pocket would be the copay. This is the case with my primary care doctor, so it didn’t seem out of the ordinary. They had my insurance information at this point, and I specifically asked (multiple times) because I didn’t want any surprises bills. Well, I got surprise bills. Make sure you check THROUGH YOUR INSURANCE about your coverage at this office. Do not trust their receptionists, they have no idea what they’re talking about. Also, be wary of parking! The street parking is very limited and I got a parking ticket on my second visit that I am contesting due to misplaced and unclear signage. Several other cars had these tickets on them as well when I came out, so if you are unsure about the signs, I suggest opting for safety and parking elsewhere.
address: Encino Dermatology & Laser: Alex Khadavi MD, 16260 Ventura Blvd #140, Encino, CA 91436

My only sort of complaint in the past has been the long waits, but he listened to his patients and has added more staff and increased his hours to see patients. name: CarolK WeHo
text:
I entered this procedure not knowing anything. I was not given a consultation before the receptionist handed me numbing cream to put all over my face. I did it, avoiding my eyes but putting it on my forehead not knowing juvederm would not be used on my forehead, and not knowing where the injections would be administered. That would have been helpful to know ahead of the numbing. The rest of the day my eyelids were numb and my eyes stung like crazy.

I asked that my lips be given a little boost and ended up with an entire syringe of juvederm. I was not expecting the result.

The nurse was good and tried hard not to hurt me. It was not bad at all. The next day i was black and blue on one side and of course needle marks all over my lips and in certain places on my face; nasal labial and cheek. Day 2 and I still look a mess. I'm assured all will be well. Stay tuned. :)
address: Encino Dermatology & Laser: Alex Khadavi MD, 16260 Ventura Blvd #140, Encino, CA 91436

text: My wife had a basic appointment here, was told over the phone that it was covered under our insurance 100%. When she went in for the appointment, she asked again if everything was covered 100% and they told her yes. She just moved here from England, where seeing the doctor is always free, so of course wanted to make sure before being charged anything. We just now got a massive bill (months later) that we were not expecting at all. In the process of inquiring at the number at the top of the bill, my wife spoke to the manager of accounts there and she laughed at my wife on the phone, saying sarcastically “oh, now that’s a good one,” referring to her believing that the visit was covered 100% based on what she was told before and during the visit. My wife then in tears after that conversation, I called back and spoke to Susan there who said “oh yeah, my manager just spoke to her” and proceeded to argue with me that it was our responsibility to see what was covered by our insurance before booking the appointment, and was also very rude to me, and threatened to hurt my wife’s credit that she’s barely even started here if we don’t pay. We canceled all future appointments here, we feel conned, and had the worst customer service experience ever.

text:

His staff is so friendly & sweet.  I just looooove Dolph.  He is such a great ambassador for the clinic.  He answered every question & addressed my concerns as well.  Dolph is so accessible too.  You can tell he loves his job & helping others.
Nicole in the clinic deserves to be acknowledged for her kindness too!  She is so super helpful & fun to be around.
I can’t say enough great things about my experience.  I wish they were in my state!  Luckily they’re just a short trip away.

The service I receieved was fillers.  It’s so soon after my service but I think I will be happy with my results.

name: Maria Carla Cadotte
text: I was referred to Dr. Khadavi by a good friend who has had several services for him.  I had been wanting to try Voluma in my cheeks but was nervous as I have only had shorter term filler in my face and wanted to be sure I was going to someone who I could trust to give me the results I wanted.  After meeting him and having seen the work he'd done for my friend I felt confident in the procedures and also inquired about a botox brow lift and a touch up on my lips.  Dr. Khadavi was so knowledgeable in everything and his assistants had me nicely numbed up and with his gentle technique I surprisingly had no pain and unbelievably no bruising!  I ended up receiving cheek and chin work with Voluma as well as lips, dysport, and also have started using his Revivogen Hair Care line (shampoo, conditioner, and hair regrowth drops so far) and love everything!! Highly recommend him for injectables and hair regrowth ...will update review soon with photos from before and after and to expand review after I have returned for skincare services and mesotherapy!!!

Let be clear with you,The LAW clearly reads as..

#1 What is the Fair Chance Act? The Fair Chance Act, which went into effect on January 1, 2018, is a California law that generally prohibits employers with five or more employees from asking about your conviction history before making you a job offer.

#2An arrest not leading to a conviction, except for unresolved arrests.
Participation in a diversion or deferral of judgment program.
A conviction that has been dismissed, expunged, otherwise invalidated, or inoperative.
A conviction in the juvenile justice system.
An offense other than a felony or misdemeanor, such as an infraction.
A conviction that is more than 7 years old (unless the position being considered supervises minors or dependent adults).
*A conviction for decriminalized conduct, including the non-commercial use and cultivation of cannabis.

#(3) Many workers and their physicians find medical cannabis beneficial for relieving painful or disabling conditions that could otherwise impede their performance. Studies funded by the State of California and elsewhere have found cannabis to be effective in the treatment of chronic pain and other conditions. Studies have also found that access to medical cannabis can reduce opioid dependence, abuse, and overdose deaths

#4Workplace drug tests have never been demonstrated safe or effective by the United States Food and Drug Administration in improving workplace safety.

#5Current workplace drug testing technology discriminates against medical cannabis use that has occurred days or weeks previously.

***12940. It is an unlawful employment practice, unless based upon a bona fide occupational qualification, or, except where based upon applicable security regulations established by the United States or the State of California:
6) (A) When used to treat a known physical or mental disability or known medical condition, the medical use of cannabis by a qualified patient or person with an identification card, as those terms are defined in Section 11362.7 of the Health and Safety Code, shall be subject to reasonable accommodation, including the use of the interactive process.

text:
When I first started, I had a little experience with Crossfit but the coaches had me do the introduction part. It was a good thing they did, otherwise i would have most likely injured myself. They have been able to work with the limitations I've acquired from my work and have been vigilant to ensure i can do as many movements correctly and safely. The staff has been great in working with my school and work schedule allowing me to get a work out in when I have the time. The atmosphere is great and the people there always try to get you to do your best. Will many of the workouts suck, at least you know you wont be suffering it alone.

One of the issues that does arise are the class times, since there is only morning and evening classes. If you only have time during the day, you may have an issue.

If you are new to Crossfit or have been doing it for a while, this location is a good place. Nicely tucked away so you can do your WODs in peace and no one can hear you scream.

name: Candace Gowin
text:
How is there only one Google review of this local gem?!

Since 2009, I’ve tried similar programs in various locations throughout the state (Madera, Fresno, Clovis, Downtown SJ). Let me tell you— the B-12 injections at this San Jose location are the best. B-12 is essential for healthy cell function, and many people in the US overlook it (search for Pernicious Anemia). I highly recommend checking this place out! This clinic is also the MOST beautiful one I’ve been to— and I really have been to quite a few over the years for vitamin injections. The clinic is really quite cozy and well-kept, and the staff is friendly! COVID precautions have been set up as well.

For the appetite suppressants, they are the usual ones that can be prescribed. They actually have A LOT of options and medication combinations to make the most of individualized programs. The prices are reasonable for the Bay Area— definitely on the pricier side for the state— but decent for the Bay Area.

For my progress, I lost 10 pounds in September 2020, so I’m on track with the overall program. I would like to note that the recommended timeline for programs such as these are incredibly variable, usually 3-6 months depending on personal goals. They DO require dedication and maintenance! A low carbohydrate diet is recommended with Dr. Syverain’s program (which is, again, standard for programs like these).

Honestly, the B-12 alone is worth looking into itself. So great!
address: Dr. Syverain Skincare Clinic, 88 Tully Rd suite 110, San Jose, CA 95111

name: Atoor Ebrahimi
text:
I lost 15 lbs in the first month after my first consultation with Dr Syverain.
And 60 lbs total in six months.  After looking around for the right weight loss doctor, I decided on Dr Syverain after seeing other patient reviews.  To be honest, I basically was looking for a fast way to loose the weight that was dragging me down.  When I told him about my busy mobile schedule, he prescribed for me appetite suppressants and B12 vitamin shots as a quick solution.  Overall, I have to say I do feel happier and confident moving around after six months of treatment.  I really value the health advices he gave me to care myself in the long haul.  I also think his fees was very reasonable.
address: Dr. Syverain Skincare Clinic, 88 Tully Rd suite 110, San Jose, CA 95111

name: Darcy Stull
text:
My daughter has been twice to Paradise Tattoo for 4 new tattoos. My dad passed away very suddenly on 12/28/20. Due to the pandemic, I had not seen him since January 2020. Myself & my family are heartbroken 💔

A few weeks after he passed my daughter made an appointment at Paradise. She came home & had gotten the word ‘sweet’ tattooed on the outside of her left forearm - near her wrist. Sweet was my dad’s last name - my maiden name. Joey had done the tattoo & it was very delicate. She mentioned that he had a light touch & was very friendly.

I didn’t have any tattoos but after seeing hers felt compelled to get one to honor my awesome dad. My daughter made an appointment for me today with Joey. I ended up with ‘Sweet’ on the inside of my left forearm near my wrist & another tattoo on my right arm in the same spot.

Joey was so nice. He explained the process throughly & asked me how I was doing while working on both tattoos. I had fun chatting with him (I am a talker!) and learning how he got into the tattoo business.

I would definitely recommend Paradise Tattoo. The establishment was clean, inviting, and the staff was very friendly!
address: Paradise tattoo, 129 Bulkhead St, Santa Cruz, CA 95060

name: Werecat
text:
I got my tattoo from Mars, or cloudsolid on Instagram, and it was all around perfect.
First of all, he is overall super nice and chill. He can draw anything you suggest and he will get it exactly how you imagine it. Then throughout the whole process he makes sure you’re comfortable, relaxed and able to keep going. During the tattoo you can just chat and have a nice convo, or if you need to relax he will just focus on the tattoo and not even mind, so he is great for all those introverted snd extroverted people. He is also very nice about working with your budget. You can tell him how much you have and he will completely work around that.
Secondly, just his tattoo machine is the best because it is so quite and feels super nice compared to other tattoo machines. For me it felt the same as someone drawing on my arm with a fine tip sharpie.
Third, the atmosphere is really nice. All the artists seem really nice and welcoming. The shop feels like a place of happy times with people being hyped about their new art or just hanging out with pals.
Overall this was by far the best experience I had getting a tattoo. The tattoo turned out absolutely amazing and I had so much fun getting it done.
address: Paradise tattoo, 129 Bulkhead St, Santa Cruz, CA 95060

name: tawni smith
text: Best tattoo shop I've been to, and I've been to quite a few! Joseph is a great artist, super professional, friendly, and does great work. Goes the extra mile to make you feel comfortable and to do great tattoos. Would reccomend him and anyone in his shop 100 times over!

name: Tim Watson
text: 3weeks ago, Dr Boeckman removed Cataracts from my right eye. My right eye has shown loads of improvement since this procedure. Can’t wait to repair my left eye, as well. Today I scheduled the left eye repair w/Dr Boeckman for Oct 1. My vision had degraded dramatically over the past years & soon Dr Boeckman will have me seeing like I did as a boy. I only wish I had found Aquity Eye Group sooner. It had gotten so that I was continually bumping into doorways, walls, tables, everything due to the loss of my peripheral vision. I’ve regained my peripheral in the right eye already.i have already referred a couple friends to Acuity Eye Group. I know They’ll not be disappointed. Wonderful, Friendly & lighthearted Staff. I’ve enjoyed the entire experience. On a 1-10 scoring system, easily Acuity deserves a 10, all the way.

name: Jeff Krieger
text: My PCP recommended that I see an Ophthalmologist for a check-up. I hadn't been to one in about 10 years. I selected Acuity Eye Group in Tustin simply because they took my insurance and it was close by. But the truth is, I had a wonderful experience. Communication was great leading up to the appointment. The check-in process went smoothly. I was called to the back by Miesha (not sure I am spelling her name correctly). She immediately made me feel at ease and she performed all of the up front exam work (drops, images, vision testing, etc.) with precision, while making me feel very comfortable. From there I met with Dr. Boeckmann who performed a detailed exam, reviewed my eye images, explained the condition of my eyes to me, and we discussed my options for future vision improvement. She was clear, made things easy for me to understand, and I felt like I was being treated like a family member. Dr. Boeckmann was personable, trustworthy, and made me feel like she really cared. I am sure that she does this with all of her patients. If you are at all hesitant about see an eye doctor, as I was, I strongly recommend Acuity Eye Group in Tustin and Dr. Boeckmann. Easing your anxiety is one of their specialties!

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback! We strive to make every patient's first experience a smooth and pleasant one, so reviews like yours make our day. We've shared your review with Dr. Boeckmann and her team.

address: Acuity Eye Group, Retina Institute & Acuity 360 Advanced Vision Center - Tustin, 14642 Newport Ave f350, Tustin, CA 92780

text:
Didn't choose to hire this company after they came out for a quote for my mother's roof.

Reasons:
- Unprofessional attitude. Did not wear a mask or shoe covers in our home.
- Showed up late for the inspection, did not call beforehand to confirm arrival.
- Left without telling us anything other than "I'll email you." (It's been a week with no further contact).

resp.text: I think you may have us confused with a one of the other companies that were out at the appointment that day.  There were two other contractors when our inspector arrived at your mother's home.  He, in fact, had to wait for one of the other contractors to finish their appointments.  He was wearing a mask, and he did not go into the home.  It generally takes 24 to 48 hours to send our proposals to our customers.  We were at your mother's home on 12/01, and I sent the proposal on 12/03 @ 10:27am.  In addition, our system sends a text notification when we are on our way as we are leaving our previous appointment, and the notification was sent at 9:40am.  Your appointment was scheduled between 10am-11am.

name: nancy brennan
text:
Tyler is super CLEAN, organized, sensitive to customer's preferences and REALLY pleasant and efficient. He explains what he is going to do before he does it, and gives you options, if there are any.  His fees are reasonable and he doesn't say any more work needs to be done than what you called him to repair. He also is careful to not damage anything around the repair, arriving with clean towels and shoe covers.

Call Jenny for pleasant, clear communication and knowledgeable responses to schedule a prompt eappointment.  (She even sends out a map link to tell you when Tyler is arriving, plus it has a picture of Tyler so you KNOW it's him when he arrives.)

I'll be calling him to install Toto toilets after the first of the year. He knows the "ins and outs" of Toto toilets already, and he will get the toilets for you. YAY!

ADDENDUM:  Tyler installed 2 Toto toilets this week. There were no problems with ordering them; the toilets were in new condition, installation went smoothly and quickly. Tyler even camera-ed the pipes under the toilet all the way to the street. No roots; no blockages.
He also found out, on a 3rd toilet, why the water level was low in the bowl. The previous plumber used a part inconsistent with the Toto toilet. While noticing that, he also noticed instead of getting the proper handle to flush the toilet, the previous plumber bent the inside bar, which was ready to break soon.  A future plumbing disaster was diverted!

As a plumber, he is repairing a gas line, too. The kitchen stove has a slow ignition time, so Tyler will remove the current regulator, as houses have low pressure gas lines that do not require a regulator. It is safe to do so and will allow for quicker ignition. (He knows the building codes!)

He can also work on leaking water pipes from the city's meter (the city/county is responsible for the meter itself and to the street) to the house.

J & T Plumbing Professionals are reliable, cost affordable,  plumbing problem preventable through maintenance service, and VERY customer service oriented.  I am a very satisfied client who can sleep more securely knowing what is done is done correctly.

resp.text: Thank you for your business Nancy! Your are so sweet!

name: Jori Kinney
text: Honesly, I have gotten so many great products from this company in the past but I am extremely unhappy with the customer service. I went to pick up 10 - 3'x6' metal signs and one of the signs did not end up in my order. I was told I would have to drive the 2.5 hrs back down south to pick up the one sign because they did not offer shipping. Understandable though, it is a large sign but I figured some sort of compensation may help. Upon talking with customer service I was told that "not equipped to pick up the order because of its size" although I had 9 other signs of the same size. I was told that the truck size was not the issue so apparently they assumed that I couldn't physically pick up the sign and loaded it into the truck for me although this is something that "they do not normally do." The man had looked at my order, and then looked to see if I had a vehicle of the correct size and immediately after said he would be right out with my order. Never once was I informed that I needed to go and physically pick it up myself or I would have. Customer service told me they provided me with a piece of cardboard to help the signs slide into the truck.  These signs were $75 a piece and had a thin piece of plastic wrap over the front which is why they would not slide on each other. Even the man helping me load the order said "I'm not sure why they wrapped it like this." So apparently providing the piece of cardboard was way over the line for them.  I always order large orders through this company but will be taking my business elsewhere simply because of the attitude of the customer service representative I spoke with.

name: Mike Elliott
text:
I have ordered from here a few different times. Sometimes I have no issues at all and other times it's like hitting my head against a brick wall. The only thing that hurts is me. Multiple times I had technical issues uploading and placing an order and tried asking for help with customer service and to no avail they didn't want to help me. Great pricing but very very poor customer service that doesn't care other than the money you give them.

They also need to re-adjust their cutoff time frame. I had an issue with trying to submit an order for same day and next day delivery on a Saturday. They told me sorry, " we can't help you due to the volume and our next day air trucks pickup by 3:15pm. That's a very short time frame with a 12pm cutoff time-frame. Very poor management and customer service.

I'm going to be looking for a new company to work with even if it means paying slightly more. The pricing is not worth the headache of their customer service department.

resp.text:
Mr. Elliott,
I’m very sorry to hear that we have not met your expectations on each and every order you have placed with us. While I’m happy that you have had some painless experiences with our services, it’s unfortunate that you feel like other times we are not being helpful. Our Customer Service team is instructed to make every effort to help. I’ll address your comments with the team.

I understand regrettably that our Same Day service option did not work out for you. Our cutoff times were implemented to give you and our other customers as much time as possible to get in orders and artwork and still meet the shipping deadline. Currently, our Same Day Cutoff is 12pm PST when that is combined with Next Day Air we only have a little over 3 hours to print, trim, pack and ship that order before the express truck picks up and leaves for that day.  Our cutoff times are in place to ensure that we meet our commitments to you and your order ships on time.

If you have a suggestion to how we can adjust these times to better serve you, we would be happy to listen.

address: B2Sign, Inc., 462 Humane Way, Pomona, CA 91766

name: ted cadwallader
text: I just wanted to thank Angie, Larry T. and anyone else in customer service that helped. We always have received the best quality in print work from B2 but ive read a lot of unfortunate experiences in regards to customer service. I wanted to be sure to point out that our experience was beyond expectations. FedEx lost the package... which was a mothers day gift for a new mother. Not only did B2 reprint and ship... but when we found out, despite B2's efforts, that the package was not going to arrive until Tuesday of this week... B2 stepped up and fixed that as well. I spoke to a very happy customer yesterday who could not thank us enough.  I wanted to be sure to pay forward that thanks! You guys are the best. Thanks again for your time and due diligence!

resp.text:
Mr Cadwallader,
Thank you very much for taking the time to share your experience with us. I am so happy to hear that we were able to help in a tough situation. We know our customers put a lot of trust in us when they bring us business, and we take pride in making every effort to assist if an issue does arise.

Thank you for the kind words, and I'll pass them along to the team.

I told her that was ridiculous and that I will refuse the charges on my cc.  She said fine, but we will remove your account with us and I would no longer be able to order from them.. I then asked to talk to her supervisor.. I was told the exact same thing.  So i guess all of  my business over the years does not mean more than a $20 banner to them.  I was floored.  I told them to keep it and they told me they would at least refund  my shipping.  Use ws display, they do care and you can talk to people who actually help. name: Taraysa Lees
text:
**Edit/Update**
After leaving several bad reviews and negative feedback on their page, I was finally contacted by an upper level manager who was very friendly, professional and helpful. She worked to resolve the issue and offered a reprint of my order. We are very pleased with the resolve and hope this was an isolated incident and that we can continue to work with B2Signs. We are still a bit leary given all the bad reviews but knowing how they operate with their automated system will hopefully shed a little light on how to work with them in the future. Again, we are happy with the resolve and hope going forward, to have a better experience in the future.

Bad customer service. My husband attempted to order from them and had some difficulty with their templates. He reached out to them via their live chat system and dealt with a very rude person who was of no help to him in the process. After several attempts at trying to get assistance from them, they basically told him sorry he was having problems and since he couldn't figure it out maybe he should just go somewhere else. He asked to speak with a manager and was told the same thing. I was able to resolve the problems he was having with his artwork and we placed the order for a table throw. Originally it had been rejected twice because he had left the template lettering in place. I deleted all of it but in the instructions it said it was okay to leave the dotted lines from the template. We sent the art work in again and it was approved and accepted. 5 days later we got our table throw and they had printed their template lines on to our product. Once again we got in touch with them via live chat. The first person we spoke to, Paula, was very rude and told us it was our fault but that she would have a manager call us. Never got a call. Contacted them again via live chat and got someone else that was nice and more apologetic and said she would have a manager contact us. A manager finally contacted us over the phone and said there was nothing he could do about it. And refused to redo the table throw or even offer a discount. They were adamant that it was our fault and not theirs even though they rejected previous artwork with template wording on it and then approved the one with the template lines. This company is not pleasant to deal with whatsoever and will not even attempt to fix and issues with their product.
address: B2Sign, Inc., 462 Humane Way, Pomona, CA 91766

If high quality prints and great customer service along with a fast turn around time on your order is what you're looking for, then B2Sign, Inc. is the company for you.
I recently purchased a large post and I was amazed by the quality they produced. The picture looked great, the colors were vibrant and the image was clear. I was absolutely blown away by the awesomeness of the poster, it was an exact replica of the image I submitted. I followed that order by ordering two car magnets for my business; unfortunately, one of them flew away because I was unaware that I was suppose let the magnets magnetize to my car for at least 24 hours before driving with them on the car. I called B2Sign to ask if they had a stronger magnet and proceeded to explain to Robert what happen, he then asked if I allowed the magnets to magnetize before driving it. I told him that I did not know that I had to do that and he immediately apologized for the miscommunication and reordered the lost magnet for me, free of charge. Thank you B2Sign for having great products and wonderful customer service.

name: Erin Jeffrey
text:
Unbelievable. I have been using B2 for some time now (years). Mostly for banners, but occasionally for table covers. They have always been fast, affordable, and I have found the online software easy to use. I work for a local print shop in Houston and do graphics and layout for customers here, so this is not something I am new to or unfamiliar with.

Today, I placed an order for a 5'x5' banner. When the order went it, it submitted as a 1'x1' banner. The price should have been a flag for me to look at the order closer, but I didn't think about it, so that is on me; however, when I uploaded the artwork, usually, if it is overset, too small, or the wrong size, the system will flag it and you will have to approve the size discrepancy. That did not happen. I got a green light that the artwork fit correctly, so I submitted it and went on my way.

Shortly after, the order confirmation came into our color department showing an order for a 1'x1' banner. I was notified and I immediately got on to the website to cancel the order. Unfortunately, it was too late to cancel and because B2 Sign wasn't open yet, I couldn't call customer service. Thinking I had made the error, I got back on to the website and went to place an order for the correct size and when I did, I realized the software wasn't calculating the size the correctly. Even though I had entered 5' x 5', the square foot calculator beneath the dimension fields showed 1'x1'. So I took a picture of it. I called B2 Sign once they opened and the customer service girl who handled the call said that it was already sent to print, they couldn't cancel the order, and all they could do is refund me the shipping, so I asked to speak to a manager. They were so swamped with calls that they told me they would have a manager call me back.

To their credit, a manager did get back with me relatively quick (an hour) and I told him what happened. This is where I have issues. This guy wouldn't even listen to what I had to say, he tells me that I put the order in wrong (even though I have been ordering banners from them regularly for years without issue), that I must have walked away from the computer mid-order which is why it switched back to a 1'x1' default (I did not walk away...), that he would refund this order the one time as a courtesy, but if I made the mistake again, (yes....he said that) he would not refund me again. When I tell him I have a picture of the software malfunction he insinuates I am a liar because he is looking at the software and it isn't doing it for him.

I have included the picture and you can see that I had hit enter after putting in the desired dimensions because, it had calculated a price. Notice the 1'x1' calculation underneath. If I had not hit enter, the price field would have remained blank as shown in the alternate photo.

You know...I understand this business and the way customers who don't know what they are doing can cost you money. Sometimes, you have to stand your ground. And I appreciate the refund. BUT when a customer that has been with you for years has a problem, it doesn't do to insult them. There are other printers closer to home that I can use that are equally inexpensive. I have been prefential to B2 because I tend to be loyal to vendors if I like them, but it looks like I don't have a reason to be that way now. And the only reason why I am not giving them one star is because of all the time before that they did a good job. Goes to show, all it takes is one time of bad to ruin ALL the good.
address: B2Sign, Inc., 462 Humane Way, Pomona, CA 91766

name: JENN-JENN MARSHALL
text:
I own an independent sign company and have also managed several different sign franchises over the years.  B2SIGN has been my GO-TO vendor for a huge percentage of my products.  First off, they offer NEXT DAY PRINTING at no additional charge.  ...and when some of my clients waited until the VERY VERY LAST MINUTE, I still had the opportunity to do a SAME DAY option still at an UNBEATABLE PRICE.

GREAT PRICES!!!  HIGH QUALITY PRODUCTS!!!  SUPER FAST TURNAROUND WITH OPTIONS TO EXPEDITE!!!

Their customer service is GREAT!  A few times I entered the incorrect shipping address and they switched it quickly with no issues.

I am able to reach them by email fast and also by phone if necessary.  No issues with communication at all.

For banners, retractable stands, etc... you're not going to find a better deal with this fast turnaround time and quality.

Their website makes it easy to calculate shipping on the spot so when I am doing bids for folks in different regions, I don't have to worry about whether or not I guesstimated the correct shipping.

Recently, they've updated the site and integrated a proofing system.  Definitely useful.

They are constantly adding new products.  I know that they just moved to a new location which probably means more room so they have space to expand.

The sign industry is a competitive business when it comes to vinyl banners etc.  B2Sign allows me to offer competitive pricing.

I appreciate your great work over the years!!!!!!!!!!!  Highly recommended!!!

name: Esper Media
text:
** UPDATE ** - B2Sign has now replaced the flag and we are satisfied with the resolution to this issue. I have changed my review from 1 Star to 3 Stars.

Refused to honor 18 month no-fade guarantee on printed flag because we are located in Arizona - even though their policy provides no such exclusions. We purchased a double-sided printed cloth flag on November 27th, 2013 because it offered an 18 month no fade guarantee. My client informed me 2 weeks ago that they were no longer able to use the flag because it had faded so badly (they hadn't used it for 2-3 months at this stage). I submitted a request to have it replaced and was told that we were outside of the warranty window (which we were not - we still had a week left until the warranty period expired). I questioned this, and their customer service rep, Robert M, then admitted that yes, we were still in the replacement window, but that now they were refusing the replacement because we are located in Arizona and the warranty only applies to cooler states. I have downloaded both the warranty language and flag care instructions from their site and there is no mention of any such restrictions. They have refused any further communications with us to settle this complaint.

name: Sheena Holder
text: We ordered 6 apps 2 foother by 3 foot outdoor posters for a customer and received  them around the 10th of Feb, 2016. We ordered the particular material because it's stated in their description that it was supposed to last for years Outdoors. It is now August upon receiving the posters two of them had damage on them from the shipping I went ahead and gave these to the customer with a guarantee that they would be replaced. We contacted me to via email at which time they told us to place a claim with them and they would provide us with the ability to do so we never heard anything back and running a very busy business there have been some time that went by before the customer mentioned replacing these posters. 5 months after making the posters the customer is seeing the lamination come off of every poster these posters were put on the side of a building in a frame that gently clamps down onto the poster. We recently submitted the claim for a second time of which the first time they deny ever speaking to us. This claim was turned down because their reasoning is the frame itself has put pressure on the poster and caused the elimination to come undone therefore it is not their fault but it is the fault of the person who installed the posters. Their description says nothing about not being able to put this material in a frame in any way I have spoken to the rep who claims to be the manager and he basically told me that it was on me so I have to replace these posters for this customer out of my own pocket this is not the first time that I have had issues with a claim from this company they continually give problems if there's anything that puts them at fault for having to replace the material the ironic part is this particular customer has four more posters that he wants to get done but is not going to do them because they will not replace the existing posters I cannot recommend this company to anyone

I was told my ports were burned out and that i needed a new motherboard. I was charged 200 bucks. The ports are still out and therefore I recieved no new motherboard. I think I was ripped off and Im not sure why. I thought i could trust this service but its obvious I can not. The new people working there don't seem as trustworthy. Go elsewhere if you can.

We go out of our way to help customers but we are human and make mistakes like anyone. We have not had any employees leave in the past 2 years. name: Stephen Arriola
text: The entire process is sketch. Nowhere online does it state that I have to stay in my car, so my first impression is having an oversized security guard yelling for no reason. I found this slightly disrespectful, but more of an unorganized ordeal. The "tender" is more of a cashier that has to make multiple trips inside and out. First to verify your Id, then take your money, then finally they come back with your order. For a place titled "express" I've had faster service from other Haven locations downtown. Prices are the only decent thing I found satisfying.

resp.text: We apologize for the security raising his voice, that is something we don't tolerate, but we have had guests with issues hearing people through the masks.  We will speak to him about this to make sure he's using a more professional tone.  This is a curbside location, so we do ask that you stay in your car due to the COVID laws to keep you and our employees safe.  You are more an welcome to place your order on site with your budtender, but if the order is already placed online, they must verify the ID before bringing any items out due to CA state laws.  If you'd prefer a walk in shop, we have several in the area, though it may take longer than our curbside pick up.  We hope you continue to be a customer with Haven, whether it's through our Express location or another.  Have a wonderful night. ❤

address: HAVEN™ Dispensary, 4855 N Bellflower Blvd, Long Beach, CA 90808

text: Excellent location for dirt bike and jeep enthusiats who also enjoy camping. Clean bathrooms with toilet paper! The park ranger stopped by and chit chatted, which was really nice. At this time of year the spots that we chose were shaded and not a whole lot of bugs. Which was very good for me! All of the other campers around us were courteous, plus it was cold enough that there were enough empty spots in between that we barely noticed other campers lol The off roading was a blast!!!! Really cannot wait to go back!

text: The Manager at our community, Jennifer Catron has been unkind, unhelpful, and just overall miserable.  She's been our manager for some time now and she is consistently rude and unkind.  The reason property managers can get away with this bad behavior is because residents do not feel safe to complain, in fear of retaliation.  The management should make random calls, as homeowners, like a mystery shopper, in order to witness and evaluate the bad behavior of their employees because residents, in their own community, should be treated with respect.   Shame on you Jennifer!!

name: Kristy W
text:
Disappointed with this HOA.

They are responsible for the green belt landscaping and tree cutting.  We called them for 2+ years for them to trim the trees that were blocking our view.  Each time we called they advised that they would have it done.   Finally the last time we called, they told us the truth - it was some sort of New Zealand tree that they felt did not need to be trimmed and had to get special approval.  They were lying to us for 2+ years.

It states in our HOA manual that a tree cannot block anyone's view by more than 15%... it was blocking 90%... but their rules do not apply to them.

We also had a tree getting overgrown in our front yard and received a letter from the HOA stating that they will fine us if we didn't have it trimmed in 30 days.  Ironic.
